message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.MM 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) category as it deals with semantic segmentation and pixel-level labelling tasks. It also mentions the deep learning paradigm, which is a popular technique in the computer vision community. 

The paper also discusses a new inference and learning framework, which suggests that it could belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) category. 

The use of Gaussian potential functions and the development of a new framework for learning pairwise CRF potentials suggests that this paper could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) category. 

The integration of the proposed framework into deep neural networks suggests that it could also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) category. 

Finally, the empirical evaluation of the proposed framework on public benchmarks for semantic segmentation suggests that it could also belong to the Multimedia (cs.MM) category.
